name: Senega
Relationship: Compare: CAUST.; PHOS.; SAPONIN; AMMON.; CALC.; NEPETA CATARIA - Catnip (to break up a cold; infantile colic; hysteria).
Modalities: Better: from sweat; bending head backwards

Eyes: Dryness, with sensation as if too large for orbits
Double vision; better only by bending head backward
Hyperphoria, better by bending head backwards
Promotes absorption of fragments of lens, after operation
Respiratory: Asthenic bronchitis of old people with chronic interstitial nephritis or chronic emphysema
Bronchial catarrh, with sore chest walls; much mucus; sensation of oppression and weight of chest
Voice unsteady, vocal cords partially paralyzed
Cough often ends in a sneeze
Pressure on chest as though lungs were forced back to spine
Difficult raising of tough, profuse mucus, in the aged
Bursting pain in back on coughing
Urine: Back, bursting distending pain in kidney region
Greatly diminished; loaded with shreds and mucus; scalding before and after urinating
Mind: Suddenly remembers unimportant regions which he saw long ago
Head: Dullness, with pressure and weakness of eyes
Pain in temples
Bursting pain in forehead
Face: Burning vesicles in corners of mouth and lips
Paralysis of left side of face
Nose: Coryza; much watery mucus and sneezing
Throat: Catarrhal inflammation of throat and fauces, with scraping hoarseness
Sensation as if membrane had been abraded

details: Catarrhal symptoms, especially of the respiratory tract, and distinct eye symptoms of a paralytic type, are most characteristic. Circumscribed spots in chest left after inflammations.
